c2d 0.0.9035

  • C2D Codebook

Add UN world regions

Source: R/c2d.gen.R
add_world_regions.Rd

Augments data with information about the United Nations (UN) geoscheme on three different grouping tiers based on the UN M49 area code hierarchy.

In total, six different columns are added:

  • un_region_tier_1_code: UN tier-1 region's M49 area code

  • un_region_tier_1_name: UN tier-1 region's English name

  • un_region_tier_2_code: UN tier-2 region's M49 area code

  • un_region_tier_2_name: UN tier-2 region's English name

  • un_region_tier_3_code: UN tier-3 region's M49 area code

  • un_region_tier_3_name: UN tier-3 region's English name

Tier-1 regions are the highest, i.e. most aggregated UN regions, commonly referred to as continents. Tier-2 regions are also known as "subregions" and tier-3 regions as "sub-subregions".

add_world_regions(data)

Arguments

data

C2D referendum data as returned by rfrnds(). A data frame that at minimum contains the column country_code (with two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes).

Value

A tibble.

Details

Note that only part of all UN tier-2 regions are further divided into UN tier-3 regions, meaning that not all countries are part of a UN tier-3 region. If a country doesn't belong to any UN tier-3 region, the corresponding un_region_tier_3_* values will simply be NA.

Examples

c2d::rfrnd(id = "5bbbe26a92a21351232dd73f") |>
  add_world_regions() |>
  dplyr::select(country_name,
                starts_with("un_"))
#> # A tibble: 1 × 8
#>   country_name un_code un_region_tier_1_name un_region_tier_1_… un_region_tier_…
#>   <chr>        <chr>   <chr>                 <chr>              <chr>           
#> 1 Switzerland  756     Europe                150                Western Europe  
#> # … with 3 more variables: un_region_tier_2_code <chr>,
#> #   un_region_tier_3_name <chr>, un_region_tier_3_code <chr>
